newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Jan manufacturing employment up 4.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Jan manufacturing employment up 4.4 pct.

text.p: Employment in Mexico's manufacturing sector rose an average 4.4 percent in January 1997 compared with the same month in 1996, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said in a statement on Tuesday.
Hours worked in the time period rose by an average 5.4 percent from the year before.
The largest increases in employment were seen in metallic products, machinery and equipment, where jobs rose by 9.0 percent, and in clothing and leather, which rose 8.9 percent, INEGI said.
In food, drink and tabacco production employment fell by 0.4 percent.

Hours worked grew most in metallic products, machinery and equipment, for a rise of 11.3 percent and in clothing and leather, for a boost of 10.6 percent. INEGI said hours worked declined by 0.8 percent in paper products and printing businesses for the time period.
